meanings.definition: To have exclusive control over a particular market or industry.
meanings.sent1: The big company tried to monopolize the entire toy market.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy businessman wanted to monopolize the oil industry.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky raccoon tried to monopolize all the shiny objects in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her loud voice seemed to monopolize the conversation, drowning out all other voices.
meanings.sent5: The bright red color of the sunset seemed to monopolize the sky, painting it with its brilliance.

meanings.definition: To dominate or control something completely.
meanings.sent1: The bully tried to monopolize the playground, not letting anyone else play.
meanings.sent2: The dictator sought to monopolize all aspects of the citizens' lives.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten attempted to monopolize the attention of the family.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter seemed to monopolize the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The powerful storm clouds seemed to monopolize the sky, blocking out the sun's rays.

meanings.definition: To take possession or control of something entirely.
meanings.sent1: The thief tried to monopolize all the jewels in the museum.
meanings.sent2: The ambitious student wanted to monopolize all the knowledge in the library.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy tried to monopolize the squeaky toy from the other dogs.
meanings.sent4: His infectious smile seemed to monopolize the room, spreading happiness to all.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the painting seemed to monopolize the art gallery, drawing in all the visitors.
